programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez investigate a case of a detective who was gunned down prior to testifying against a career criminal; Frank personally investigates when Garrett is attacked by a SWAT team outside his home; Erin brings in a confidential informant.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez investigate the murder of a single mother whose ex-husband has a history of violence; Mayor Dutton eliminates solitary confinement in prisons; Jamie's efforts to save a young woman who overdosed on drugs has unexpected consequences.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A famous basketball player is found dead of an apparent drug overdose; Danny looks into possible ties to a local drug gang; Erin revisits the case of a man she may have wrongfully convicted years ago; Frank is approached by Archbishop Kearns.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A case turns personal when Danny works to protect a nurse from her violent ex-boyfriend; an acquaintance of Frank's comes forth with a theory regarding the death of an inmate; Jamie and Eddie help deliver a baby.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Eddie's judgment is clouded by her past when she arrests a loathed college acquaintance; Frank is hesitant to mar the spotless record of a member of the force who tested positive for marijuana.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez join a narcotics task force to track a drug supplier; Baez comes into contact with drugs and gets an accidental overdose; Jamie and Eddie work to protect a rehabilitated sex offender; Frank forms an unlikely alliance with Mayor Dutton.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Sonny tells a national magazine that truckers are the toughest men in America and lands in a Marine boot camp to prove it.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Sonny and Will pick up a carnival elephant in North Carolina to deliver in Florida.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Sonny and Will come to the aid of a widow who is determined to locate her mobile home on a lot willed to her by her late husband, a lot which turns out to be a public park.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Sonny and Will help a tobacco farmer after the trailer they are pulling catches fire and burns the man's barn down.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a Navy lieutenant on liberty dies of bubonic plague, NCIS Special Agent Tony DiNozzo helps the New Orleans team as they try to control a potential outbreak and find the source of the infectious disease.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: An armored transport bus crashes, resulting in the escape of four prisoners -- including a black market broker topping the list of national security threats; Pride needs Gibbs' help with a case file full of redactions.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a Navy SEAL is found dead in a sorority house, the team must determine if his death was related to collegiate foul play or a classified mission; Pride's daughter visits the office.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The investigation into a chief warrant officer's death reveals that his wife has been abducted -- leaving the team with a 22-hour deadline; senior FBI agent Fornell assists with the case.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Amidst Halloween festivities in New Orleans, a Naval Staff Judge Advocate dressed in a costume is found dead in a cemetery; the team debates Halloween costumes and activities.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: An investigation into a drug robbery gone wrong reveals Voight has ties to a teen linked to a double murder; Desk Sgt. Platt cares for a young girl.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A case involving one of Chicago's most wanted fugitives hits close to home with Olinsky; an altercation with another officer lands Sean Roman in hot water; Platt helps Nadia prepare for her polygraph test.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: After arriving in Chicago to assist Voight and the team with a rape/murder case that has distinct similarities to a decade-old case from New York, Sgt. Benson asks Fin and Amaro to help; the prime suspect asks for a meeting with Lindsay.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Still struggling with a loss, the team must put feelings aside when a cafe is bombed; Atwater winds up in hot water after making a mistake.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A mass shooting takes place in an athletic club; Atwater deals with his new assignment; Halstead and Platt try to check up on Lindsay.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Voight and the team help retired Cmdr. Perry extract his nephew from a corrupt unit; Lindsay struggles to stay clean; a woman from Olinsky's past contacts him.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Intelligence pursues heroin kingpin Derek Keyes; Lindsay's downward spiral continues; Olinsky tells Platt about a secret from his past; Roman talks to Burgess about his concerns regarding Ruzek.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Roman and Burgess discover the corpse of a young boy who was reported missing; Burgess talks to Ruzek about Roman's suspicious behavior; Bunny plans to make a statement that could impact Voight's career.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A desperate man searching for his daughter holds a member of the team hostage; Voight learns about the accusations Bunny made regarding a case from his past; Antonio finds out that Olinsky has been keeping a secret.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Burgess works an extra shift at the 13th District and gets caught in the middle of a drive-by attack on refugees; the team works together to track down the shooter and uncover the true motive behind the attack.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Atwater turns to an unlikely source of support when a string of jewelry store robberies shakes his confidence.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Voight believes the man who tried to kill him is someone he and Olinsky once put away; Atwater unintentionally spills information about Ruzek's history that disturbs Burgess.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Ruzek's future with the unit is in question after a botched undercover job; a corpse is discovered in an SUV; Lindsay and Halstead move forward with their relationship.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Ruzek's future with the unit is in question after a botched undercover job; a corpse is discovered in an SUV; Lindsay and Halstead move forward with their relationship.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Intelligence searches for a missing teen who they believe poses a threat to students at his school; Atwater wants to make a good impression on a police captain.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A Detective from Atlanta pays Nick and Sylvie to help in search of the local coroner's brother, who is in possession of the heart of a dead crime lord. The heart contains the evidence that there was fowl play in his death, and now the police and the real killer have descended on Key Mariah to find him, and more importantly the heart.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: After Sylvie shoots and kills a perp, her world shatters when she is told that the dead man was an undercover cop and she ends up in jail. Nick refuses to believe that the shooting was unjustified and investigates the cop's background.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: An old contact of Nick brings one of the DEA's top ten deadly assassins to the Key Mariah who is looking to settle an old score.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: While in the company of friends, Spider tells a tale of one of Nick and Sylvie's cases the way he remembers it.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A gang tricks Nick into helping them commit a robbery. He gets arrested immediately. While Sylvie and Spider ask around outside, he looks for members of the gang among the other prisoners.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil creates a catapult out of popsicle sticks to demonstrate elastic energy, then makes a larger one that can launch pumpkins.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Friction is everywhere; Phil can't be blamed for trying to reduce it as much as he can; He builds a leaf-blower powered hover disc that he can ride; He also tries to increase his friction enough so he can climb straight up the walls.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Did you know a beavers teeth never stop growing and that it can use them to build dams big enough to see from outer space? A flock of Canada geese can migrate 1500 miles in a single day. Plus, the Bison can move 40 mph!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The bald eagle can travel up to100 miles per hour during an aerial attack on unsespecting prey. Jellyfish are equipped with the deadliest venom on earth. Plus, a camels mouth is built to eat almost anything!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Visit NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center and learn how a fleet of satellites is monitoring our planet. Philippe flies in a DC3 aircraft over Arizona as part of NASA's efforts to take soil moisture readings. Also, interviews with numerous Astronauts!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores the wild frontier of Alaska. He takes a trip deep into bear country and witnesses a brown bear hunting for salmon. We fly through the Denali National Park and land on a glacier near the tallest mountain in North America.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarret and Catherine meet a boy whose father is missing and could be in grave danger.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a professor is murdered, his boss, his teaching assistant and a student all come under suspicion.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Chin is kidnapped and left in Halawa prison dressed as an inmate, he must escape before the other prisoners recognize him.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The night before an election, the governor asks the team to investigate when a prostitute is found dead in a missing congressman's bed; Danny waits for a custody decision.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A double amputee (Peter Weller) goes after the police officers responsible for his injuries -- including McGarrett.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a Lua master; McGarrett has a private investigator tail his mother.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Danny obsesses about the big game during all-pro weekend in Hawaii; a star football player helps the team investigate the murder of a tech executive.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a murder victim lands in Dog the Bounty Hunter's vehicle, Catherine goes under cover and investigates at a local roller derby.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team struggles to narrow down a suspect when threats against a company that endangers sharks turn deadly; Kamekona tries to earn his helicopter license.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: Jail life takes a physical toll on Monalisa; Sheri watches out for Mackenzie; Ashleigh faces the aftermath of a difficult first night; Ryan's cellmate has a violent confrontation with another inmate; Quintin attempts to call his daughter.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: Hazing, drug use and violence envelop Clark County Jail; two participants consider dropping out of the program.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: Chaos ensues in the Clark County Jail when two pod bosses threaten the safety of three of the participants.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: The jailed civilians deal with harassment, violence and the stress of incarceration as they continue to grind out their time; two of the participants approach a tipping point.

programme.title: Mobsters
programme.desc: Made famous by Martin Scorcese s film Goodfellas, Jimmy "The Gent" Burke was one of the most prolific mob earners in New York history.

programme.title: Mobsters
programme.desc: With over 30 years as the head of the Colombo crime family, Carmine Persico stands as one of most enduring Godfathers in mafia history.

programme.title: Mobsters
programme.desc: The Chicago underworld was thrown into chaos when Frank Calabrese Jr., son of mobster Frank Calabrese, flipped against his father.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: John Gotti was the last of the classic gangsters in New York City; unlike other mafia chiefs, he loved attention; he ran a multi-million dollar illegal operation that thrived on prostitution, extortion, gambling, theft and drugs.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: A chef thinks he has hit the jackpot when he finds love with the waitress he had been pursuing, but he soon realizes he is just wrapped up in her deadly plan.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: Kim Edwards and Lucas Markham's romance was like something from a teen novel; together they made a cold-blooded plan to get rid of the mom and sister Kim bitterly resented.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: Elizabeth Olten, nine, lived near Bustamante; Bustamante convinced her younger sister to bring Olten to the forest by their homes to play.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: A scorned lover serves her cheating lover his last-ever meal when he leaves her for another woman after a 16-year romance.

programme.title: Ivan Milat: Buried Secrets
programme.desc: In February 1971, nearly 30 years before Ivan Milat was convicted and sentenced to life in prison, a young woman was murdered on the outskirts of Canberra, Australia.

programme.title: Ivan Milat: Buried Secrets
programme.desc: Forensic anthropologist and criminologist Dr Xanth Mallett and criminal psychologist Tim Watson-Munro have re-opened cold murder cases across New South Wales in Australia to piece together clues that may link the murders to serial killer Ivan Milat.

programme.title: The Family That Slays Together
programme.desc: When Nikki Orvin married Damon Bamberg she had no idea what a twisted family she was now part of.

programme.title: The Family That Slays Together
programme.desc: Alberto Macias loves his wife Laura and his five children and is doing his very best to provide for them during hard times. Then he is found murdered, with two bullet holes in his head.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: In 1989, 21-year-old Lyle and 18-year-old Erik Menendez walked into their parents' den and killed them. In this limited series premiere, Erik Menendez himself shares in stunning detail the events of the week leading up to the murders and the motive behind the crime that shocked America.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: The Trial of the Century takes a shocking turn when the defense says Erik and Lyle Menendez killed their parents after years of sexual abuse.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: Erik Menendez recalls his mother's decline in the years leading up to the murders and looks on in agony as his brother Lyle testifies, vividly describing the abuse at the hands of their father.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: The first trial ends in a stunning surprise verdict. Erik alone takes us inside the prep for his second trial, his unlikely connection with OJ Simpson, and why he alone is left to speak for both the brothers

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: After the verdict comes in, at the last minute, Erik Menendez and his brother, Lyle, are sent to separate prisons. Erik marries and begins to mount an appeal. Will his case be given another chance?

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike trek to Colorado for a 1971 Ford Crew Cab 4x4 tow truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: It's the mullet-car showdown, a battle of dirt-cheap beaters: an SN95 Mustang V-6 and a third-gen Camaro with a 305 that's so gutless it might as well be a V-6.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike test out the cars they've built that are still running.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Roadkill brings back a Mazda pickup powered by a 455 Oldsmobile in the bed!

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike take a 1950 Ford truck and add a Chevy transmission.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: People love it when the crew rescues old cars from the junkyard; they literally hack a '56 Buick Century out of a thorn bush it's been sitting in for 25 years.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike score a 1970 Dodge Challenger racer from a fan in Oregon.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A 1991 Cadillac Brougham is converted into the swingin' Broughammer with a Cummins turbodiesel; with special guests Tony Angelo and Lucky Costa of "Hot Rod Garage."

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike take a 1970 Dodge Challenger to a swap meet for speed parts.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Highlighting the Roadkill Boost Caboose, a trailer with an engine that powers a centrifugal supercharger that sends boost to the tow vehicle.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys get a 1968 Datsun 520 mini truck and a 1971 Plymouth Road Runner.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Roadkill fans always ask to see a competition with hosts David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan; they each buy a car for $1,500 and enter the Optima Ultimate Street Car Invitational in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike get together with the Mighty Car Mods, Marty and Moog.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan host from the annual Hot Rod Power Tour road trip including Roadkill project cars and a never-before-seen Hot Rod show video.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The mayhem is back complete with its new 707hp drivetrain from a 2015 Dodge Charger Hellcat; the off-road Hornet; the Disgustang; the Crusher Impala; time for big action.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan built (or unbuilt) the Vette Kart: an '85 Chevy Corvette stripped to nothing but a chassis and powertrain; now, it's back and the guys try to execute the least-predictable stunt ever.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan drive the mid-engined, GMC Crew Cab, road-going dragster 500 miles to the Roadkill Zip-Tie Drags at Tucson Dragway.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Last time the guys tried to rescue this 1977 Chevy El Camino, the result was a transmission fluid spill that can still be seen from space; now it's back as the guys attempt a road trip to the Merrill Ice Drags on a frozen river in Wisconsin.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Building 440-powered Suzuki Samurai entirely out of a junkyard in Arizona.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Old fashioned, fun road trip in random, unreliable junk; David and Mike buy a 1966 Ford Econoline flat-face pickup, sight unseen, and hit the road.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike play around in hot-rodded pickups with a few friends.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan's loved Chargers since he was a kid; he recently bought a long-abandoned '68 Dodge Charger that's lasted 48 years in as-built condition; Finnegan works with buddies Tony Angelo, David Newbern and Daniel Boshears to bring it back to life.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Taking a 50-year-old car from a junkyard and motoring it to the 14,115-foot summit of Pikes Peak in Colorado.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David, Mike and Steve throw cars off a cliff at Glacier View in Alaska.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Draguar makes an epic return all the way to racing at NHRA Nationals.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Vanishing Paint Challenger is back with an upgraded suspension and it's ready to dominate the autocross; David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich enter Tire Rack SCCA Solo Nationals in Lincoln, Neb., a mere 1,700 miles away.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: It's a Roadkill challenge like no other; David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan are joined by Motor Trend hosts for an all-out war on tires.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike salvage a Road Runner that had an encounter with a pole.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike work on improving their Mazdarati mini-truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys road trip a big-block 1980 Dodge Mirada to Du Quoin, Illinois.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys road trip two beaters to a deserted factory for a winter battle.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys' attempt at a Hemi Gremmie road trip is foiled by engine trouble.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan buy an '86 Trans Am and take it for its first road test on the drag-and-drive event Sick Week; with a swapped 350 V8 and a six-speed, the big question is whether they be able to make it faster each day or even finish the race.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Freiburger attempt to get a bucket-list '66 Corvette -- abandoned halfway through an LS swap and restoration -- back on the road. With multiple iterations and attempts, the 'Vette hasn't been on the road for 30 years. Will they change that?

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern light the tires as they road test their LS-powered '66 C2 Corvette from Oakland to Las Vegas with the smokiest burnouts ever. Follow along as they blaze the coast and hit the drag strip with Dulcich before breaking down in Sin City.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Steve finds a '71 Pontiac T-37 at a junkyard in Idaho; Mike and David take their time reviving a motor that's been sitting for 38 years.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern give new life to a '57 Chevy Bel Air that was pulled from a junkyard after more than 30 years. The guys drop in a small-block V8 and turbo 350 to get the car back on the pavement for a bumpy road trip back to where it came from.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan meet up with Derek Bieri to take a 1968 big-block Dart on a tire-smoking road trip, which includes a final run down Memphis International Raceway and some high-speed passes down George Ray's Wildcat Dragstrip.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern revive the '73 Chevy Ramp Truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan surprises Freiburger by fixing up the Gremmie for Roadkill Nights.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A road trip keeps Freiburger distracted prior to the Hemi Gremmie surprise.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan drive the Hemi Gremmie from Detroit to St. Louis.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys fix and tune their way to Arizona to rescue a '75 Dodge Dart.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Crusher Impala gets a new 9-inch rear and a suspension overhaul.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: After a tune up, the '69 Crusher Impala hits the road and the dragstrip.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich and Wiley Stevens prep two cars for a farm rally course.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freibuger and Dulcich can't pass up buying a '41 Ford former race car.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Wiley Stevens and Chris Birdsong join Dulcich to revive the Wreck Runner.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys take a '68 Dart home for an engine bay makeover and tune-up.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys revive Roadkill's '66 Dodge D100 to dig out a buried '60 Ranchero.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys bring a '60 Ford Ranchero back to life after 40+ years of neglect.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys work on the Crusher Impala to see if they can get it to run 10s.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Wiley Stevens and Chris Birdsong help transplant a Hemi into the '74 D100.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich attempt to get a '67 Jeep Wagoneer back on the road.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys take on a 1971 Rally Red Duster that hasn't moved since 1993.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve digs through some East Coast rust at Bernardston Auto Wrecking.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve is in northeastern Pennsylvania, tripping through a dormant boneyard.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve is in the Mile High City searching for vintage metal.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve travels to Sandy, Oregon, to pay homage to the Chrysler Corporation.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve searches at All American Classics, a popular salvage yard in WA.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve Magnate finds an AMC Marlin and a Plymouth sedan in Denton, Texas.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve travels to Arizona to uncover a '60 Lincoln Continental Mark V.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve Magnante discovers a '61 Chevy Impala bubble top in Georgia.

programme.desc: NFL Channel's Midseason Awards featuring highlights of candidates for Offensive Rookie of the Year for the 2024 NFL season.

programme.title: NFL GameDay View
programme.desc: Host Patrick Claybon and a panel of experts pick every game on the NFL schedule with insights from reporters around the country and in-depth statistical analysis, plus feedback from fans as they make their vote on who will win each week.

programme.title: NFL Daily
programme.desc: Gregg Rosenthal and a rotating crew of elite NFL Media co-hosts, including Patrick Claybon, Colleen Wolfe, Steve Wyche, Nick Shook and Jourdan Rodrigue of The Athletic get viewers caught up daily on all the NFL news and analysis.

programme.title: The Insiders
programme.desc: NFL Media Insiders Ian Rapoport, Mike Garafolo and Tom Pelissero deliver the inside scoop and latest storylines of the week.

programme.title: NFL Fantasy Football Show
programme.desc: Marcas Grant and Michael F. Florio are back for a new edition of the NFL Fantasy Football Podcast to preview every game on the slate.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: Ahead of Super Bowl LVI, find out how the first 55 Super Bowls rank against one another.

programme.title: NFL Daily
programme.desc: Gregg Rosenthal and a rotating crew of elite NFL Media co-hosts, including Patrick Claybon, Colleen Wolfe, Steve Wyche, Nick Shook and Jourdan Rodrigue of The Athletic get viewers caught up daily on all the NFL news and analysis.

programme.title: The Insiders
programme.desc: NFL Media Insiders Ian Rapoport, Mike Garafolo and Tom Pelissero deliver the inside scoop and latest storylines of the week.

programme.title: Weekly Game Recaps
programme.desc: Highlights and interviews from the NFL.

programme.title: Weekly Game Previews
programme.desc: Preview every game from Week 11 of the 2023 NFL season.

programme.title: Start 'Em, Sit 'Em
programme.desc: The Fantasy crew breaks down which players to start and which players to sit for Week 5.

programme.title: Hard Knocks in Season: The Indianapolis Colts
programme.desc: The Colts enter a December schedule in which every game is crucial; they travel to Houston to play the Texans; running back Jonathan Taylor resumes his assault on the 2021 rushing title behind one of the best offensive lines led by Quenton Nelson.

programme.title: Hard Knocks in Season: The Indianapolis Colts
programme.desc: The Colts, fresh off their 41-16 victory in Buffalo and with growing MVP buzz about running back Jonathan Taylor, come home for Thanksgiving and face their biggest test yet against Tom Brady and the defending Super Bowl Champion Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Younghoe Koo's 52-yard field goal as time expired in regulation forced overtime, and Cousins took care of the rest as he set a franchise record with 509 passing yards to lift Atlanta (3-2) into a tie atop the division.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Rookie QB Jayden Daniels shined, going 21 of 23 with 254 yards and 3 TDs, leading the Commanders to a 38-33 victory over the Bengals. Joe Burrow's 324 yards weren't enough to avoid Cincinnati's 0-3 start.

Jeff Platt, Brent Hanks, and Amanda Leatherman call the action, with a guest appearance from Daniel Negreanu!"

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #3: $10,000 Pot-Limit Omaha final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Ronald Keijzer is the chip leader ahead of Alex Livingston, Allan Le, Damjan Radanov, Dan Shak, and Ben Lamb, as the final six players play for the $202,500 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Devil's Kiss
programme.desc: Jaz and Taz are more than just sisters, they are two street assassins with a taste for money, respect and blood. After killing the brother of a local kingpin, Jaz and Taz find themselves on the run leaving a trail of drugs and betrayal.

programme.title: Kingsmen
programme.desc: Follows the story of the King family, a known crime syndicate. When their patriarch is killed, they fall under the wrath of a rival crime family, as well as the police. The four eldest brothers will do everything they can to protect their family.

programme.title: Swing
programme.desc: An aspiring jazz musician leaves 1945 Philadelphia for fame and fortune in Harlem when an audition sends him into a web of terror and violence.

programme.title: 10 Reasons Why Men Cheat
programme.desc: In the wake of a wedding catastrophe, three couples discover the meaning of commitment while discussing what women want to know most of all when it comes to men and relationships.

programme.title: Art of Love
programme.desc: After a government contracted hit goes wrong, the collateral damage causes Lucas Alba to retire. He may be done, but his past eventually catches up with him, putting his life in jeopardy.

programme.title: Behind Closed Doors 2: Toxic Workplace
programme.desc: Newly hired employee Joy carries high hopes for success at her new marketing job, but her boss's intentions are anything but professional.

programme.title: Being on Top
programme.desc: Four women, Sophia Simmons, Dylan Carter, Portia Fitzgerald and Bridgette Barlow, who at the height of their careers are leaders in their industry, discover that having it all is easier said than done. Faced with the challenge of wanting both a professional and a personal life, they realize that life at the top can at times be isolating, and require sacrificing the authority and control they've earned professionally.

programme.title: Blood 4 Blood
programme.desc: Having lost her mom in a car wreck and then her dad to a couple of thugs, a young girl plots her vengeance for the eve of her high school graduation.

programme.title: Boxed In
programme.desc: Up-and-coming boxer Ria is focused only on her sport—until she meets Tuga, and learns that a life without love really isn't a life at all.

programme.title: Busted and Disgusted
programme.desc: Promise is envious of Faith and her success, so she seeks to claim some of that happiness by any means necessary, no matter the cost.

programme.title: Code of Envy
programme.desc: Two lifelong friends find their close-knit relationship unraveling when a new member of their group is consumed with envy.

programme.title: Con Queens
programme.desc: After being betrayed by her closest friend, a woman sets out to break free from jail and get back control of her life.

programme.title: Bloodguilt
programme.desc: David and best friend Uriah run a marketing firm together. When he meets Uriah's wife Bathsheba, he begins a dangerous affair that could unravel everything the two friends have built.

programme.title: Dangerous Thirst
programme.desc: In an attempt to spice up their marriage, a young couple steps into the sultry world of swinging, but their journey comes at a price.

programme.title: Fist of Vengeance
programme.desc: A woman, struggling with life after the death of her father, discovers a secret operation that is connected to his murder.

programme.title: Office Secrets
programme.desc: As Alvin climbs to the top, he uncovers Mr. Leonard's dark secrets, setting off a chain reaction of suspense. Meanwhile, Victoria's vendetta adds a spicy twist to the mix, creating a captivating story where love, revenge, and corporate chaos collide in the most unexpected ways.

programme.title: Covered Silence
programme.desc: After years of trauma, LaLa checks in at a mental hospital and forms an unbreakable bond of friendship with Niani. Once released, LaLa takes it upon herself to protect fragile Niani at all costs, until LaLa's estranged mother returns.

programme.title: Cruel Ambition
programme.desc: Filmmakers Woodson and Behr seek out local investor Leon to fund their feature film but find themselves blackballed. Thinking their luck has changed when they come upon a jackpot, they find out just how cruel ambition can really be.

programme.title: Complex
programme.desc: The disappearance of a woman and the murder of another leads to the investigation of four different families, living inside of one apartment complex.

programme.title: Class Dismissed
programme.desc: When an unemployed actress finds herself broke and sleeping on her best friend's couch, she is forced to get a job as a substitute teacher working with one student. She soon realizes that it takes real super powers to deal with this classroom terror.

programme.title: Conflict of Interest
programme.desc: When Mickey (Christopher McDonald) returns to the police force after a long hiatus, he has his sights set on shady businessman Gideon (Judd Nelson). Everyone knows that Gideon peddles drugs and sex and sells stolen cars. When Mickey's son, Jason (Gregory Alan Harris), is framed for murder, Mickey is set to prove that Gideon is behind it all. In his search for justice and revenge, Mickey is willing to do anything, and he's determined to shut Gideon down forever.

programme.title: Counterplot
programme.desc: Hiding out in Puerto Rico from a murder rap and double-crossing lawyer in New York, Brock Miller Brock concocts a plan to catch the real killer.

programme.title: Cuffin Season
programme.desc: When Nate's livelihood becomes dependent on his marital status, he makes it his mission to find a wife in a city where most are single.

programme.title: Dangerous Affair
programme.desc: Erika ends an affair with a man in her apartment building but the man has other plans.

programme.title: Deadly Housewife
programme.desc: Florence is a housewife who yearns for something new and exciting in her love life. Things turn deadly real quick when she doesn't get what she wants.

programme.title: Design ER
programme.desc: Dre has aspirations of making it big in the cannabis industry, but when his perceived star plant dies, his hopes and dreams start to fade. He finds himself and his 2 buddies embark on a wild adventure with their sights set on the .

programme.title: Till Death Do Us 2
programme.desc: The fates of Tamara, TJ, and even Marcus himself hang in the balance after the bloody kitchen shooting. Meanwhile, Jessica, TJ's ex-wife, faces scrutiny for her past actions and the future of their children. With the threat of child protective services looming, the clock is ticking to find answers and rebuild shattered lives.

programme.title: Truth Talks
programme.desc: A bold series exploring provocative topics with celebrity interviews and voices of the voiceless.

programme.title: Colorado Territory
programme.desc: Outlaw Wes McQueen (Joel McCrea) escapes from jail and travels to a meeting with his old partner-in-crime Dave Rickard (Basil Ruysdael). Convinced by Rickard to do one last heist, he finds out that his fellow henchmen are not to be trusted and the woman he truly loves is an ex-saloon girl (Virginia Mayo).

programme.desc: Jim Bowie encounters a bear and must flee for his life, the event which inspired the first Bowie knife to be made.

programme.desc: Jim Bowie accepts an appointment as a deputy to protect a prisoner from mob violence, who, being son of a French society at odds with Americans, is falsely accused of a crime committed by his father.

programme.desc: An elderly prospector searching for gold finally strikes paydirt, but before he can file a claim, he is killed by a pair of drifters who stampede a wild horse herd over the man's body.

programme.desc: When a thief confesses to the robbery of a stage coach, he also implicates someone who worked the job as a partner,a banker.

programme.desc: Sheriff Hollister volunteers to escort a young visitor to see her uncle on a nearby ranch, but her relative appears to be missing, and the man's partner is less than helpful.

The Treasury Department suspects Jackson because of the large bankroll he's carrying, but Yancy believes that the miner is being set up as a patsy by the real counterfeiters.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer

Now Yancy must find a way to ease the last vestiges of the Civil War before someone dies!

programme.desc: While escorting to prison the leader of a notorious gang, a sheriff and a deputy are attacked by the gang.

Joey and Fury form a special bond and embark upon lifetime adventures at the Broken Wheel Ranch!

programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie’s faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is disappointed when everyone but Becky forgets about his birthday; Darlene faces another issue; Dan excludes Jackie from the family Christmas Santa photo for mistreating Louis

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners resist Becky's Packers fan boyfriend; Dan emphasizes family loyalty to the Bears to Mark; Ben and Darlene seek a loan for their magazine.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene’s thrilled when Harris gets into Central Illinois State, but she may have other plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Bev returns, wants to spread happiness with her money. She offers to fund Mark's coding camp tuition, but Darlene suggests giving it to Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are dealing with the pandemic and life's financial troubles; the Lunch Box is closed for everything but takeout and delivery.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mary is devastated that Halloween has been canceled by the city, so Darlene and Becky enlist Jackie and the rest of the family to create an unforgettable experience.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene isolates herself from her co-workers at Wellman Plastics, leaving them with the impression she is an elitist snob.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Beverly Rose's first birthday -- but it's not all cake and candles -- when Becky and Emilio disagree on what kind of party they should have.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene's friendship with a manager at Wellman Plastics lands her in an awkward situation; Louise's brother tries to win over Jackie.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben's mom arrives after an unexpected death and unveils shocking information from the past; Becky and Emilio spend more time together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris brings home her new friend, Josh, leaving the family questioning his intentions; Becky and Ben's attempt to build a closet stirs up family drama.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky is working double shifts and taking classes at the community college, resulting in less time with her daughter; Dan decides to foster an elderly dog.

programme.desc: Darlene learns shocking news about a friend; the Conners family comes together to help someone close to them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.desc: Mark is stressed and exhausted from studying for an important entrance exam, so Darlene steps in to help, but her plan backfires.

programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: It's time for 'The Final' of 'Total Wipeout' season 2.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Time again for the world of celebrity to take on the most outrageous obstacle course in the name of charity.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Dirty Balls, The Wall Swing, The Crusher, Crazy Beams and Big Donuts are some of the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: Contestants are ejected from the show in the craziest and most outrageous ways possible.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: The game is divided into two teams, one with UK contestants and the other with people from all over the world.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Ten celebrities from the world of sport and television take on one of the most extreme obstacle courses.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Twenty contestants take on one of television's largest and most extreme obstacle courses.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard's co-host Amanda Byram is course-side in Buenos Aires as 20 Brits tackle the Argentinian course.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the last episode of the season and the 7 previous winners compete to be the Champion of Champions.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the 'Legends Special' with all of the worst but funniest competitors from the last three series.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: “Masterchef” all-stars are back to win.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 10 participate in the season’s most crucial team challenge when the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR restaurant opens its doors to a special group of VIP female role models. The team that dishes up the most impressive meal will go straight into the Top 8, but it’s going to take more than skill to win over this exclusive group of guests. The losing team will face a Gordon Ramsay masterclass in which they will be tasked with replicating a three-Michelin-star-rated dish. See who advances.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The race to be the next MASTERCHEF JUNIOR shifts into full gear as the Top Eight pair up in the most intense mystery box challenge of the season, in which the chef-testants are challenged to pull off something highly creative and seriously delicious with corn. Only one will win a game-changing advantage that is certain to cause a ruckus in the tapas-themed, tag-team challenge. The best junior home cooks in America are put to the test.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay continues to work with the owner of Mill Street Bistro to fix his belligerent attitude.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: In Seattle, Chef Ramsay hopes to improve a family-owned Greek restaurant that resists catering to the changing demographic of the neighborhood.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The remaining chefs are treated to live Greek dancing. Afterwards, they must choose a protein to cook a Greek dish with. The winners race go-karts while the losers clean the kitchens.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Each team must create a dish using either beer, wine or liquor. “Cheers” star John Ratzenberger appears as a guest judge.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Finale Pt 2 - Michael Cimarusti

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: “Masterchef” all-stars are back to win.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top Six junior home cooks tackle the most daunting challenge in MASTERCHEF JUNIOR history when they take over Michelin Star Los Angeles restaurant Mélisse. To rise to the occasion, the teams face an intense environment, hungry guests with high expectations and the wrath of Gordon Ramsay. Find out which team makes it straight into the semifinal and which team will be sent into eliminations.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the season’s last mystery box challenge, the remaining contestants receive a surprise taste from home when they are tasked with creating a dish inspired by family. Whoever wins this challenge will immediately earn a spot in the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR finale. Then, in a juicy elimination test, the chef-testant who elevates a secret ingredient with the most finesse and personality will secure his or her spot in the finale. See how far the junior home cooks have come.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay helps professional belly dancer-turned-restaurant owner Rishi with her eatery. With little kitchen experience, Rishi lets the head chef control kitchen operations.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: The owners of Chappyês, a Cajun-style restaurant, had to move in the wake of Hurricane Katrina. Now in Nashville, theyêre struggling to find a loyal base of customers.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The remaining chefs must cook with exotic proteins, including ostrich and wild boar, to impress Chef Ramsay and the owners of the restaurant Animal.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs cook a Mardi Gras-themed homecoming dinner for Calabasas High School. Both teams have 35 minutes to create three meals for the homecoming committee.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: A battle of the culinary world’s next generation comes to a head in this exciting two-hour finale showdown. The season began with 24 contestants, but now only three young chef-testants remain standing. The challenges this year were more intense, and more inspiring, than ever before. It’s a fight to the finish and only one will take it all home – the trophy, the coveted title of MASTERCHEF JUNIOR and the $100,000 grand prize. Watch as the home cooks dish up the best three-course meal of their lives, proving they have what it takes to win.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: On day three, the chosen finalists cook their main courses, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Tom Kerridge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's desserts day in the finals, and the last chance for the competing chefs to impress the judges and veteran Angela Hartnett. After a hard-fought week, the end of this programme will see the judges finally reveal the winning four dishes which will make up this year's `Great British Menu'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure on the chefs to deliver is immense, and even the Great British Menu judges roll up their sleeves to ensure that the banquet goes according to plan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of the Scottish chefs, Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison, in the battle of the starters. So which dish is going to fly the flag for Scotland? Will it be cock-a-leekie terrine, pigeon salad or Scotch pie?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Scottish chefs are all fighting for supremacy in the fish course. So who is going to come out on top? Will it be lobster cocktail cooked four ways, lobster with vegetables, or mussels and langoustine with sorrel soup and tattie scones?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle of the main courses, as the Scottish chefs go all out to win, with their takes on hogget Scotch pie with peas and carrots, steak and chips with a tomato relish and lamb with haggis, pearl barley and turnip puree.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the Scottish chefs Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison to show they've got what it takes to win. So which dessert will deliver the sweet smell of success - strawberry shortbread with whisky cream, carrot cake with cream cheese ice-cream or rhubarb and custard with ginger biscuits? And which chef will be going home early?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is judgement day and the two chefs must cook their entire menus for the Great British Menu judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only two chefs can make it through to cook for the Great British Menu judges at the end of the week and one will be going home. That decision lies with former champion Marcus Wareing, who will scrutinise their dishes every day. Today it's the starters, so which dish will he think worthy of the banquet? Will it be poached & roasted chicken with new season onions, wild rabbit and leek turnover with piccalilli, or rabbit pudding with parched peas and gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the fish course, which dish is going to be king: turbot with brown shrimps and spring vegetables, wild sea bass with shrimp toastie, or bream with hazelnuts and salted caramel?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course. Will the winning dish be Gloucester Old Spot pork with smoked venison, salt marsh lamb with sweetbreads, or oak roast middle white pork with broad beans?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing chooses his favourite from the three dishes: caramel parfait with honey ice-cream, rhubarb and custard tart with beetroot ice-cream, and strawberries with meringue and mint water ice. For one of the chefs, this is the end of the road.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The heat is on, as only one chef can make it through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is it going to be?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland launch their culinary assault with the starters: braised hog's head with apple sorbet, white onion soup with roasted muntjac, and rabbit and smoked bacon salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland are all out to impress with their fish dishes: crab in barley soup with smoked oyster, hay baked rainbow trout and beetroot cured sea trout.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland square off in the battle of the main courses. So which dish will get top marks: pigeon and rabbit with carrot terrine, lamb with purple sprouting broccoli or lamb with asparagus crown?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the central region to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be, heather honey custard with rhubarb, queen of puddings or lavender junket with mead jelly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The gloves are off, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet. Who is going to come out fighting?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: rabbit with pea mousse, ham hock with pea puree and heather smoked macon with pickled beetroot.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from the South West - Henry Herbert, John Hooker and Nathan Outlaw - are all out to impress with their fish dishes: cider-cured sea trout, poached lobster with courgette flowers and trout, crayfish and pike mousse.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the South West to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be: sea buckthorn curd meringue, gooseberry Queen of Puddings or lemon meringue with honey ice-cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: a summer salad of pea mousse with pickled beetroot, ham hock with smoked cheddar mousse and chicken terrine with asparagus, onion and jasmine.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: poached lobster with confit potatoes, sea bass with brown crab, and sea trout with apple, beetroot and smoked mussels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams pull out all the stops with their main courses: Welsh black beef with leek and potato terrine, loin and shoulder of hogget with morels, and lamb four ways with salt-baked celeriac.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their desserts: lemon verbena baked custard, mint mousse with hazelnut biscuit and beetroot parfait with chocolate and raspberry brownie.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be a wild rabbit with ham hock, carrots, asparagus and morels; wild rabbit with a baby leaf salad, black pudding, crispy quail's egg, broad beans and a shot of real ale; or warm pork and apple pie with chilled tomato soup, Yorkshire cheeses and homemade pickle?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: line-caught North Sea mackerel with gooseberries; pickled shellfish and wood smoked crispy prawns with the `smell of the sea'; and smoked trout soup with beetroot, cucumber and oyster nuggets.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Kenny Atkinson, Tim Bilton and Lee Bennett are determined to win but which dish will take first place? Will it be roe deer with beetroot, cauliflower and sage; venison three ways with English garden vegetables; or braised feather blade of beef and Yorkshire pudding with beer and onion gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Which dessert will earn top marks? Strawberry jelly crumble with elderflower custard; a `Best of British' dessert plate - bread and butter pudding, rhubarb and custard, curd tart and strawberries and cream; or brandy snap with cider brandy cream, basil sorbet and summer fruits?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent the North East and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the Northern Irish chefs want the honour of cooking for HRH Prince of Wales. They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be quail with asparagus, pork terrine with liver mousse, or slow-cooked pork belly with peas, morels and wild garlic? Former champion Richard Corrigan will decide.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: black sole fillet with crab; seared hand dived scallops and shellfish with seaweed butter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from Northern Ireland battle it out with their main courses. Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna are determined to win, but which dish will take pole position? Will it be loin of lamb, rack of lamb with slow-cooked shoulder or fillet of Shorthorn beef with bone marrow?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna deliver their desserts but which dish will earn top marks; strawberry and elderflower jelly with doughnuts and duck egg ice cream, poached rhubarb with lavender ice cream or brandy strawberry parfait with basil ice cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent Northern Ireland and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales, but who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: a summer salad of pea mousse with pickled beetroot, ham hock with smoked cheddar mousse and chicken terrine with asparagus, onion and jasmine.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: poached lobster with confit potatoes, sea bass with brown crab, and sea trout with apple, beetroot and smoked mussels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the main course and rabbit, rose veal and venison are all dished up for `Great British Menu' veteran Richard Corrigan. Plus, one of the chefs is joined by `Eastenders' star June Brown for a fundraising challenge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course. Will a strawberry and coconut dessert, a frozen white chocolate dish or apple and cherries come out on top? `Great British Menu' veteran judge Richard Corrigan will decide who goes through to the judges tomorrow.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from London and the South East. One chef left the competition last time and only two remain. They will cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. This time they will be joined by celebrity guest judge, comedienne and writer Arabella Weir.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is finals week and 24 of the nation's finest chefs have been whittled down to just eight. Over the course of four hour-long shows, they will battle it out in the kitchen for the chance to get a dish to the Comic Relief Banquet. Actress Patricia Hodge, one of the stars of sitcom `Miranda', joins judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort to taste all eight winning regional starter courses.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their fish courses. They are all vying to finish in the top three and still be in with a chance of cooking at the special banquet. Tensions are high but there are still plenty of laughs as new dishes are introduced under competition rules, including a Sicilian influenced dish called the `Cod Father'. Impressionist Ronni Ancona joins the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Comedian Ade Edmondson tucks into the chefs' main courses to help decide which three will remain in contention to cook at the special banquet. However, the chefs are in for a major surprise as the judges deliver unexpected news about the day's competition.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's judgement day as the chefs not only learn the top three desserts but the judges announce the winning menu. `Fast Show' writer and performer Charlie Higson helps judge the puddings. Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort decide on the four winning dishes, but there is a problem - they are torn between two dishes for one of the courses.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the climax of the competition as the winning chefs cook at the Comic Relief Banquet at the Royal Albert Hall. Special guest and co-founder of the charity Richard Curtis welcomes guests - the unsung heroes of charity work, as well as those who have benefited from their help and some of the celebrities who have inspired us to do something funny for money.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their starters. A dish celebrating childhood summer memories takes on a complicated courgette dish and a technically tricky take on the cucumber sandwich.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more intense as all the chefs take risks with their dishes. Mike Reid, executive chef at M Restaurants in London, shocks when he pairs his fish with some highly unusual flavours.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a smoke filled kitchen as the three chefs prepare their summer-themed mains in the hope of impressing the veteran judge. Selin Kiazim is in her element, cooking a feast inspired by the summer barbecues she enjoyed with her family.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are feeling the pressure as they attempt their technical summer desserts. With only the two highest scorers going through to the regional final, who will be sent home?

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.desc: Tom Parker is eager to impress with a salad that includes 10 elements. Meanwhile, Paul Askew, hopes his traditional techniques will triumph over his younger competitors, and Ellis Barrie is taking a risk with a creative cucumber and oyster starter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the atmosphere in the kitchen gets even tenser as the three newcomers begin to understand the perfection and skill the veteran chef demands. Ellis Barrie attempts to create the flavour of a summer barbecue.

programme.title: Gardeners' World

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team celebrate the joy that gardens and gardening can bring by looking back at some of their seasonal highlights. Monty Don harvests tomatoes from the greenhouse and plants out some of his favourite flowers for long-lasting summer colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants tender annuals for high summer colour, as well as sharing his tips for growing cherries and pruning blackcurrants. Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge that has become a focal point for the local community.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain’s seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don arrives in the eighteenth century, an age that gave rise to the landscape garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: This week Mark continues his hunt in Australia on Marble Island. After a successful first day, the group heads out the next morning in search of a Sambar stag. After closing the distance Mark isn’t able to get a steady rest so they move in closer while the Sambar stag is on the move.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is known as the “Slam guy.” He has completed the North America and South America Waterfowl slams, each in a single season. After some thought and due diligence, Mark is now embarking on a journey to complete one of the most diverse slams there is, The New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. Mark starts this journey with his 828 U Benelli, going after turkey and quail.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: WE join Bobby Falkenberg as he joins Bret Ferguson from Double T Outfitters. Bobby is an avid outdoorsman, judge, and father of 5. Bret manages 30,000 acres in Ozona TX, the knowledge he has of every inch of this amazing low fence ranch is remarkable. Bobby has an action packed 2 day hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week our team visits The Rocky Creek Ranch with two long time supporters of TTHA, Blake Barnett and John Fink. The goal in this episode is white management, which is something both Blake and John are passionate about. Blake has been hunting many years but what takes place in this hunt is a first.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: The Break
programme.desc: The Turkey Professor, Joe Hoehn, swaps his Browning Maxus turkey gun for an X-Bolt and slug gun as he hits the deer woods in Missouri and Illinois.

programme.title: rmef
programme.desc: Well-known for producing some of the highest quality firearms for more than a century, the Browning X-Bolt can lift the “average Joe” hunter to the level of dead-eye marksman. To showcase how simple it can be, self-proclaimed “average hunter” Brandon Bates takes a brand new Browning X-Bolt right out of the box and goes to the range to see what this production rifle can do in “custom rifle” scenarios.

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: Antlers on ConQuest deer farm must be removed to ensure the safety of bucks fighting and killing each other. Watch how Doug Roberts selects only the best typical bucks for his breeding program.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: On today's episode we have Mike Counihan, a NYPD office, a 1st Phorm elite athlete, and an avid surf fisherman. He turned his passion for working out and staying fit into a life motto; NO DONUTS HERE. He believes that everyone needs to be physically active to live life to the fullest, to be their best self and to operate at their highest capacity. He's also starting a podcast called Mike & Mike.Follow him on IG at: https://www.instagram.com/nodonutshere/?hl=en Follow @1stphorm !
